text: I previously said Tracking URLs, but that's actually not right. I think you'd want HubSpot Calls To Action instead.

I think the that Tracking URLs will only "fire" on the page load, so the best you could get would be some interstitial page that loads, runs the script, and then redirects to the file URL.

On the other hand, that's what HubSpot Calls to Action (CTAs) already do...

hey! nice to finally join the dev community properly. I used to do marketing, learned code and now am fulltime in revenue ops. Big fan of building on top of hbspt. API — Once I built multi-step forms for HubSpot, please feel free to use if it’s relevant to you at all:

<https://github.com/thesnappingdog/HubSpot-multistep-form-generator>
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Lists-Lead-Scoring-Workflows/Multi-Step-Forms-Possible/td-p/218073>
Am currently very much exploring timeline events / analytics api to pull out data out of HubSpot for a project, hit me up if thats smt you work with/interest in :slightly_smiling_face:
